description: '''African heavy metal''' refers to the [[heavy metal music]] scene in Africa, particularly in East African countries such as [[Kenya]] and [[Uganda]], and Southern African countries including [[Namibia]], [[Madagascar]], [[Angola]], [[Botswana]], [[South Africa]], [[Mozambique]], and [[Zimbabwe]]. It also extends into North African nations such as [[Algeria]], [[Egypt]], [[Libya]], [[Morocco]], and [[Tunisia]]. African heavy metal is characterized by the use of European and American metal genres, usually blended with traditional African instruments and musical styles, creating distinct regional differences.
